meanings.sent1: She absolutizes her rules, never allowing any exceptions.
meanings.sent2: It is important not to absolutize every decision, sometimes flexibility is needed.
meanings.sent3: The teacher absolutized the homework deadline, causing panic among the students.
meanings.sent4: His belief in honesty is so strong, it seems to absolutize his entire character.
meanings.sent5: The king's decree absolutized the new law, making it impossible to challenge.

meanings.definition: To treat as absolute or ultimate.
meanings.sent1: He absolutizes his favorite book, claiming it is the best ever written.
meanings.sent2: Some people tend to absolutize their opinions, refusing to consider other viewpoints.
meanings.sent3: The child absolutized his toy as the most precious possession in the world.
meanings.sent4: Her love for him absolutized him in her eyes, making him seem perfect.
meanings.sent5: The artist absolutized the beauty of nature in his paintings, capturing its essence.
